channel.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
channel.description:
Hey I'm rather new to this community in all, but when [b]I run No-IP, and my server, I run the client[/b], and with my [b]No-IP domain set as the IP address,[/b] it gets stuck at [b]"Connecting to Update Server"[/b] and in the [b]CMD[/b] it states that there is an [b]"error_game_js5connect"[/b]
Run.cmd - client folder [code]@echo off cd files java -Xmx256m client 66 live live software members english game1 pause [/code]
Run.cmd - server folder [code]@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause[/code]
Do any of you have a [b]solution[/b] to this problem?
[u][i]Please no flame, or unwanted posts. - All posts will be reported.[/i][/u]

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

SuperSoft:

Do I need the .titan cache or cache508?

Dl a normal 508 cache, rename it cache508 , and move it to c:

Read full topic

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @anelm anelm
item.description:
@anelm wrote:

this is what helped me take the run.bat that comes with the client and put it in the folder where the files are then run it again.

Read full topic

@SuperSoft wrote:

Do I need the .titan cache or cache508?

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

Very simple, you dont have the cache in c: or you didnt connect to localhost.

Read full topic

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @SuperSoft SuperSoft
item.description:
@SuperSoft wrote:

[quote=“kedonot1, post:5, topic:250449”]Serveral Reasons,

  1. Server isn’t up.
  2. You didn’t portforward ( No-ip renames ur ip, doesnt portforward for you)
  3. Cache is being gay
  4. Your server doesn’t compiablty with the client, such as using a 503 or, 477, or 417[/quote]

3 out of 4 of those have been explained.

In my topic I bolded statements that have problems, and what I’ve done.

You just came in her and told me what I’m already doing, congratulations.

Read full topic

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @kedonot1 kedonot1
item.description:
@kedonot1 wrote:

Serveral Reasons,

  1. Server isn’t up.
  2. You didn’t portforward ( No-ip renames ur ip, doesnt portforward for you)
  3. Cache is being gay
  4. Your server doesn’t compiablty with the client, such as using a 503 or, 477, or 417

Read full topic

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @SuperSoft SuperSoft
item.description:
@SuperSoft wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:3, topic:250449”]u trying to connect online or locally?

if locally…dont put any i.p

if online, portforward (not sure if its works with 508’s)[/quote]

I’ve portforwarded already. It doesn’t even work with an IP Changing Client.

Read full topic

u trying to connect online or locally?

if locally…dont put any i.p

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

I think the client’s IP has to be set to that of the server before running it.
I’m not certain of that, however.

Read full topic

item.title: [508 Server] error_game_js5connect
item.dc:creator: @SuperSoft SuperSoft
item.description:
@SuperSoft wrote:

Hey I’m rather new to this community in all, but when I run No-IP, and my server, I run the client, and with my No-IP domain set as the IP address, it gets stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” and in the CMD it states that there is an “error_game_js5connect”

Run.cmd - client folder

@echo off cd files java -Xmx256m client 66 live live software members english game1 pause

Run.cmd - server folder

@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause
